intro: Pastinaca trysia, commonly known as the Persian salsify, is a biennial plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its thick, edible roots. The plant produces yellow flowers in umbels, typical of the family, and has finely divided, fern-like leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun for optimal growth. Due to its historical use in cooking and medicine, it remains a subject of botanical and culinary interest.
